reviewText:
Early Access Review

It has a lot of potential but a long way to go. Mechanically the game is sound but there is a plethora of small bugs that I'm sure will be resolved before the game is released.

Gameplay video of first level
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dHeTuZvPG80
Note: Opening sequence was not laggy at all in game, not sure why screen capture had issues with it.
voteText: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWow, very impressive for an early access game. The game has the feel of a N64 platformer like Mario 64 or or even Conker's. You can tell that the environement design is still being activly developed but the world is already very lush with lots of vegetation that leaves very little edge geometry in view which gives the game a very organic aesthetic. A couple other polished elements I have enjoyed is the cinegraphic quality of the camera and also the soundtrack. The combination of the two keep you engaged and even the sparser environments have a directed feel. I'll be keeping an eye on this game as it's being developed. Excited to play the final product!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

WHAT A GREAT GAME! I saw this had come out of early access, and im usually hesitant about e.a. but this was cheap and reminded me of SuperMario64 or Zelda64. It plays well, works on my desktop and chromebook (which is amazing) and is great on Linux. I do expect more levels and some more polish in the graphics/texture area however.

Still, it works on a chromebook Intel Celeron 2955U Dual-core 1.40 GHz Perfectly.

Intel CPU Specs:
Graphics Base Frequency	200 MHz
Graphics Max Dynamic Frequency	1 GHz

*EDIT: I also appreciate that the Dev is responding to customers here and on reddit. Keep it up!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nJust started playing the game, but I get the retro feel from it! I hope more people see and play this game!
Early Access Review\n\nThis game is worth it for the soundtrack alone. This is what happens when an artist also programs.
